intro: Agrostophyllum longinode, commonly known as the long-node grass. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae, characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist or wetland environments. Its leaves are narrow and grassy, with small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. Agrostophyllum longinode is often used in traditional medicine and as a source of fiber in some cultures.
